Apparently, there is a technique for extracting crystals similar to Amber from rainwater. Gain 10 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber every time you use 50 units of water in Rain Engines. Blightrot Cysts grow 25% quicker when using Rain Engines.
Gain 1 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber for every 50 <sprite name="[mat raw] wood"> Wood produced.

An odd talisman made from the talons of a phoenix. Gain 2 <sprite name="hearth parts"> Wildfire Essence for every 2 completed Dangerous or Forbidden Glade Events. (except cloned events spawned by fishmen caves and blood flowers)
An old, forbidden ritual. Increases yields by 100% in all buildings that use fertile soil. You will lose all stored food (cooked and raw) upon choosing this cornerstone.

A crystalline filter designed to mitigate the negative environmental impact of infused rainwater. Blightrot Cysts appear 50% slower when using rain engines, but Reputation from Resolve is generated 90% slower for the next 2 Reputation Points.
Gain 20 <sprite name="[crafting] coal"> Coal for every 3 burned Blightrot Cysts.
All buildings cost 40% less, but every newly discovered resource node has -5 fewer charges.
Villagers have a +10% higher chance of producing double yields, but consumption control is disabled.

Machinery specialized in extracting copper from petrified trees. Gain 1 <sprite name="[metal] copper ore"> Copper Ore for every 5 <sprite name="[mat raw] wood"> Wood produced. All <sprite name="[metal] crystalized dew"> Crystalized Dew production is reduced by 1 (whether from gathering, farming, or production).

You took some of the best explorers from the Smoldering City with you. Global Resolve is boosted by +5 for 180 seconds every time a new glade is discovered, but woodcutting is 33% slower until you open at least 2 glades.
All workers have a +10% higher chance of producing double yields, but they also have a +20% higher chance of consuming twice as much food during a break.
Relatives of your villagers send gifts for treating their family members well. Get 40 <sprite name="[vessel] waterskin"> Waterskins for every full Reputation Point obtained through high Resolve.
Strange roots spread across the land. <sprite name="[mat raw] wood"> Wood production is increased by +1, but harvesting and planting are 25% slower.
An old inscription on the bottom of the hat says: "Fortune and glory". Increases the chance of bringing back twice as much from Glade Events by 50%.
If you leave rainwater for a while, it will begin to release a pleasant and warm vapor. Food production speed is increased by +10% for every 50 units of drizzle water stored.

Securing the deadliest corners of the forest will make it a lot less terrifying. Every discovered Forbidden Glade lowers the Hostility gained from Dangerous and Forbidden Glades by 2, and from small glades by 1. (the bonus is added retroactively)
Powerful and precise machinery. <sprite name="[mat processed] parts"> Parts (<sprite name=grade3>) can be produced in the Smithy.
The crown doesn't need to know everything. There is no Impatience penalty when villagers leave or die, but Impatience will grow 600% faster, starting from Drizzle year 9.
One who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with all. Every Glade Event solved by making a decision marked as Empathy lowers Hostility by â€‘40. (the bonus is added retroactively)
Every 3 burnt Blightrot Cysts lowers Hostility by â€‘10. While the Hearth is corrupted, youâ€™re unable to sacrifice resources.
The forest recedes, as heavily guarded trade caravans pour into the settlement. Hostility is reduced by â€‘10 points every time you sell goods worth 30 Amber.
Rainwater seems to soothe the forest. Hostility is reduced by â€‘10 points every time you use 150 units of water in Rain Engines.
All houses have room for 1 more villager.
A mysterious Amber orb with a magical flame trapped within. Increases the Ancient Hearth's resistance by 250 for every 2 woodcutters in your settlement.
Hostility is reduced by 40 for every Hearth upgraded to: Neighborhood (Level 2) (or higher).
All camp production is increased by 100%, but all buildings that use fertile soil have their yields decreased by 50%. Bonus does not affect the Woodcutters' Camp.
Gain 2 <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects every time woodcutters cut down a tree during the Storm.
The cost of knowledge can be very high. You can see the content of undiscovered glades, but discovering Dangerous or Forbidden Glades kills 1 villager.
There is nothing the forest hates more than fire. Every villager with their need for religion fulfilled decreases the forestâ€™s Hostility by 5.

An unusual amount of supplies can be found in some glades. Gain 40 <sprite name="[food raw] meat"> Meat and 40 <sprite name="[food raw] grain"> Grain for each completed Dangerous or Forbidden Glade Event. (except cloned events spawned by fishmen caves and blood flowers)

You are allowed to use the legendary Mist Piercers. With such a rare gift at your disposal, the Queen's expectations are high. The content of glades will be revealed, but each discovered glade increases the Queenâ€™s Impatience by 0.5.

Big strategic changes always come with an adjustment period. Every neighboring town offers +2 more trade routes, but no trader will arrive in your settlement until you complete at least 5 trade routes. Traders currently staying in the settlement will leave immediately.
All farms can plant <sprite name="[food raw] mushrooms"> mushrooms (<sprite name=grade2>) on farm fields during drizzle season.

Rumor has it that your settlement is one of the wealthiest in the realm. Newcomers will arrive 15% quicker and bring 10% more goods for every 1 level of standing you have with other settlements on trade routes. (the bonus is added retroactively)
Newly discovered resource nodes have more charges (+15 charges to small deposits, +40 charges to large deposits), but you'll gain +10 Hostility upon picking this cornerstone.
Gain 1 <sprite name="[mat processed] parts"> Parts every time you sell goods worth 25 Amber.
A standardized set of rules. Every villager with their need for education fulfilled increases global production speed by 5%.
Newly discovered resource nodes have more charges: +5 for small deposits, and +15 for large deposits.
Glade event work speed increased by 30%. Resources you sacrifice in the Ancient Hearth burn 25% quicker.
The settlement is known as a trading hub in the region. Gain 1 Reputation Point every time you sell goods worth 60 Amber, while slowing the Reputation gained from Resolve by 75%.
Global Resolve is increased by 5, but the chance of villagers consuming twice the amount of food during a break is increased by +50%.
The people are feeling oddly rebellious. Gain +1 Global Resolve for every 2 Impatience Points. Every time a villager leaves or dies, Impatience is increased by an additional 0.2 points.
Gain +1 to Global Resolve every time you sell goods worth 50 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber.
The Crown is very forgiving - as long as the goods keep flowing. Impatience grows 30% slower for 180 seconds every time you finish a trade route.

The Crown sends two Royal Guards to your village. Instead of simply brawling, villagers will now train under them. Fulfilling the need for brawling grants an additional +5 to Resolve, but attacking a trader will result in you getting 2 extra Impatience Points.
Gain 3 <sprite name="[tools] simple tools"> Tools every time a villager leaves or dies.
Woodcutters are tasked with creating makeshift tools. Discovering a glade during the Storm grants 10 <sprite name="[tools] simple tools"> Tools.
Global production speed is 33% faster, but traders will arrive 50% slower.
For every 10 completed trade routes, all houses will have room for one more person.
Gain +2 to wood production. After each storm, all stored wood is removed, and you get 50 <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects in return.
If you want to take, you first must give. +1 to <sprite name="[mat raw] wood"> Wood production. Lose all stored fuel upon picking this cornerstone.
Scouting ahead makes it easier to prepare for the worst. Discovering a small glade increases the working speed of scouts investigating Dangerous or Forbidden Glade Events by 50% for 180 seconds.

Scouts are so focused on looting that they unintentionally damage the environment. Increases the chance of bringing back twice as many resources from Abandoned Caches by 100%, but newly discovered resource nodes have fewer charges (-5 charges to small deposits, -15 charges to large deposits).
A complicated runic structure, designed to shield the hearth from corruption. The Ancient Hearth's resistance to corruption is increased by 400.
With provisions, haulers don't have to return to the Hearth as often. Increases time between breaks for haulers by +50%.
Two rainpunk hauling carts will be assigned to the Main Warehouse to help transport resources between buildings.
An automated rainpunk cart will be assigned to every warehouse in the settlement to help transport resources between buildings.
Some fossils contain valuable surprises. Gain 2 <sprite name="[valuable] amber"> Amber for every 20 <sprite name="[crafting] sea marrow"> Sea Marrow produced.
The fresh resin still glows softly with the rain's essence. Gain 4 <sprite name="[metal] crystalized dew"> Crystalized Dew for every 20 <sprite name="[mat raw] resin"> Resin produced.
+2 to <sprite name="[food raw] berries"> Berries production. Gain additional <sprite name="[food raw] berries"> Berries every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
+2 to <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects production. Gain additional <sprite name="[food raw] insects"> Insects every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
Any Woodcutter can carry 5 additional items.
+2 to <sprite name="[mat raw] resin"> Resin production. Gain additional <sprite name="[mat raw] resin"> Resin every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
+2 to <sprite name="[food raw] roots"> Roots production. Gain additional <sprite name="[food raw] roots"> Roots every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
Planting crops is 30% faster.
+2 to <sprite name="[packs] pack of crops"> Pack of Crops production. Gain additional <sprite name="[packs] pack of crops"> Pack of Crops every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
+2 to <sprite name="[food raw] mushrooms"> Mushrooms production. Gain additional <sprite name="[food raw] mushrooms"> Mushrooms every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
+2 to <sprite name="[metal] crystalized dew"> Crystalized Dew production. Gain additional <sprite name="[metal] crystalized dew"> Crystalized Dew every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
+2 to <sprite name="[mat raw] clay"> Clay production. Gain additional <sprite name="[mat raw] clay"> Clay every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
<sprite name="[vessel] barrels"> Barrels (<sprite name=grade1>) can now be produced in the Lumber Mill and Smithy.
+2 to <sprite name="[metal] copper ore"> Copper Ore production. Gain additional <sprite name="[metal] copper ore"> Copper Ore every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
+2 to <sprite name="[crafting] coal"> Coal production. Gain additional <sprite name="[crafting] coal"> Coal every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
An old manuscript detailing long-forgotten burning rites. Fuel burns 33% longer in Hearths.
+2 to <sprite name="[food raw] meat"> Meat production. Gain additional <sprite name="[food raw] meat"> Meat every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
+2 to <sprite name="[crafting] sea marrow"> Sea Marrow production. Gain additional <sprite name="[crafting] sea marrow"> Sea Marrow every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
+2 to <sprite name="[tools] simple tools"> Tools production. Gain additional <sprite name="[tools] simple tools"> Tools every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
+2 to <sprite name="[mat processed] bricks"> Bricks production. Gain additional <sprite name="[mat processed] bricks"> Bricks every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
+2 to <sprite name="[food raw] eggs"> Eggs production. Gain additional <sprite name="[food raw] eggs"> Eggs every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
+5 to <sprite name="[needs] tea"> Tea production. Gain additional <sprite name="[needs] tea"> Tea every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
+5 to <sprite name="[needs] incense"> Incense production. Gain additional <sprite name="[needs] incense"> Incense every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
Storm clouds seem softer. All Negative Forest Mysteries require a higher Hostility level (+1) to activate during the Storm.
+2 to <sprite name="[food processed] skewers"> Skewers production. Gain additional <sprite name="[food processed] skewers"> Skewers every yield (from gathering, farming, or production).
<sprite name="[mat processed] parts"> Parts (<sprite name=grade3>) can be produced at the Crude Workstation
